glsa.title: gEDA: Insecure temporary file creation
glsa.synopsis: An insecure temporary file usage has been reported in gEDA, allowing for symlink attacks.

background.p: gEDA is an Electronic Design Automation tool used for electrical circuit design.

description.p: Dmitry E. Oboukhov reported an insecure temporary file usage within the sch2eaglepos.sh script.

impact.p: A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All gEDA users should upgrade to the latest version:
